command: bash -lc 'set -euo pipefail; ts=$(date -u +%FT%TZ); d=$(date -u +%F); dest=/opt/ti/closed/whois/$d; mkdir -p "$dest"; if scp -q -i /etc/ssh/keys/domaintools_ed25519 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=yes -o UserKnownHostsFile=/etc/ssh/known_hosts_domaintools -o IdentitiesOnly=yes whois@sftp.domaintools-pro.net:/feeds/history/acme_corp/whois_history.xml{,.sha256} "$dest"/ && (cd "$dest" && sha256sum -c whois_history.xml.sha256); then printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"domaintools-pro\",\"artifact\":\"%s/whois_history.xml\",\"status\":\"verified\"}\n" "$ts" "$dest" | tee -a /var/log/ti_fetch.json; else printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"domaintools-pro\",\"status\":\"error\"}\n" "$ts" >&2; fi'
explanation: Collects a paywalled WHOIS history dataset (XML) for the target organization from a closed-source provider over SFTP, with checksum verification and JSON logging.
rationale_steps: Connect to the provider's SFTP endpoint with key-based auth and host key pinning.
Download closed-source WHOIS history XML and checksum.
Persist data and emit structured JSON for auditability.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid flags, appropriate error handling with set -euo pipefail, and correct variable usage throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by securely retrieving non-public WHOIS data from a paid provider (DomainTools) using SFTP with proper authentication, verification, and logging mechanisms.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The Bash one-liner has balanced quotes and parentheses, valid scp/ssh options, proper command chaining, and correctly escaped printf JSON strings.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It acquires a paywalled WHOIS history file from a closed-source provider via authenticated SSH file transfer, verifies its checksum, organizes it by date, and logs a T1597-tagged JSON event, aligning with Search Closed Sources.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, valid flags, proper separators, and correct syntax for all included shell features and commands.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent of collecting intelligence from a closed source via SFTP with verification and logging, aligning precisely with the T1597 technique and demonstrating high operational plausibility.
